intro: Lonchocarpus patens, commonly known as the white spurred bean, is a tropical climbing legume native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive spurred flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
